{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3488365,"name":"","username":"HoneyTrain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T19:48:11.891Z","cooked":"

Hello, we are having a problem with our VH-109 radio. We are trying to configure it to connect wirelessly. We have it wired so that it takes power from the VRM that is powered by a PDP and running an ethernet cable from the rio directly to the radio. It receives power, but the 2.4 Ghz light isn’t on. All of the other status lights are on and solid. Then when we try to connect to radio.local, it says that the site cannot be reached. Does anyone has guidance for this?

20250120_1143351920×1440 103 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T19:48:11.891Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":341,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":1785.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71585,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3488369,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T19:49:39.843Z","cooked":"

You don’t need to power it from the VRM, it should be directly wired to the PDP. To enable the 2.4 GHz AP requires flipping a DIP switch, have you done that? Have you configured the radio otherwise (eg set the team number)? Is the computer connected wirelessly to the network (eg has it joined)?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T19:51:50.414Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":274,"readers_count":273,"score":89.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3488371,"name":"","username":"HoneyTrain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T19:51:05.459Z","cooked":"

Yes, we have the 3rd and 1st switch flipped on. Let me try to remove the vrm to see if it changes anything.

We were able to connect to the radio a few weeks ago and it had the team number, it just stopped working recently.

Removing the vrm didn’t change anything. The 2.4 ghz light is still off, the network isn’t showing and we cannot connect to radio.local.

My recommendation would be to try and reconfigure the network adapter using the new Network Assistant Tool. There you should be able to fix the issue with it not reaching, and also make sure it’s on the newest firmware and formatted correctly.

This is what we see. How do we know which network to choose from?

With ours we needed to set a static
Ip address and DNS for the Ethernet. After this we typed 192.168.69.1 into Google and the sight could be accessed.

This being said, vivid hosting created a network assistant tool to help with this since these radios can be such pains in the butt

Less pain in the butt, more…requiring folks to learn networking basics

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T21:54:40.528Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":57.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":69630,"username":"programminggonewrong","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/programminggonewrong/{size}/239880_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3488503,"name":"Aaron","username":"kindagood","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kindagood/{size}/257968_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-20T22:22:37.533Z","cooked":"

Connect the VH-109 through the DS port with Ethernet to the computer. Not all computers have an Ethernet port nowadays so you may need the adapter you use for the driver station.

Then you should see an Ethernet option on the tool.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-20T22:27:50.255Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":216,"readers_count":215,"score":48.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"Aaron","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":71585,"username":"HoneyTrain","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/91b2a8/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51409,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST is the best STEM program"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/10","custom_user_title":"FIRST is the best STEM program","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3488781,"name":"Kiet Chau","username":"kiettyyyy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kiettyyyy/{size}/194009_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T06:07:08.993Z","cooked":"
HoneyTrain:

All of the other status lights are on and solid

All the ethernet status lights are on solid? Did you guys load the 1.2.5 or greater firmware update?

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T06:07:08.993Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":76.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"Kiet Chau","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":"Vivid-Hosting","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/5/0/50d2e846f0add7aa9489092abe0f436644dde98d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":62,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6398,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/11","custom_user_title":"CEO @ Vivid-Hosting, Mentor @ Team 1538 / The Holy Cows","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3489019,"name":"Mohammed","username":"Mohammed","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mohammed/{size}/255781_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-21T17:33:07.342Z","cooked":"

Connect an Ethernet cable from the radio’s DS to a computer, and then try accessing the IP address 192.168.69.1 in your browser instead of radio.local, as the DNS might not have been set up correctly. If this does not work, use a tool like Angry IP Scanner to perform a manual IP scan, as it can scan the entire IP range for active IPs. Once connected, verify whether the radio is configured as a Robot Radio and NOT as an Access Point and might as well check the firmware version.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":35,"updated_at":"2025-01-21T17:33:07.342Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":190,"readers_count":189,"score":53.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":482774,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light","display_username":"Mohammed","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/angryip/ipscan/releases","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Releases · angryip/ipscan · GitHub","clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61815,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-not-connecting-to-radio-local-and-no-2-4-ghz-status-light/482774/12","custom_user_title":"3065 Lead Programmer | Alumni","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3489404,"name":"","username":"HoneyTrain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/h/91b2a8/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-22T00:23:33.390Z","cooked":"

The DS port light flickers and for some reason, the RIO port has a light even when there is not cable connected to it. We’ve also run the Vivid Hosting Network Assistant and here are our results:

Screenshot (69)1366×768 85 KB

What is FRC-4? You should see a LAN connection, or will need one to update the firmware and set up the team number and SSID. Also, unless I’m missing something these radios also require a WPA pwd to be set.

Hey there! We seem to be having the same issue. We connected fine to the radio at first and configured everything, then all of a sudden, network connectivity dropped and nothing works any more. The status lights turn on immediately (for us it’s Power, Sys, and 6G) and remain solid forever (no blinking). We can’t connect to any of the ethernet ports any more (those lights remain turning off even with a cable plugged in). We currently have a support ticket open with VH. Hopefully we get a resolution soon!
